Braised Beef Short Ribs with Parmesan Polenta
Braised Beef Short Ribs with Parmesan Polenta

Author: Alicia
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 4 hours
Total Time: 4 hours 30 min
Yield: 4 servings

For the Short Ribs:
"• 1.5 lbs. bone-in short ribs
• 2 Tbsp. extra virgin olive oil
• salt and pepper to taste
• 1/2 a yellow onion, diced
• cloves garlic, minced
• 12 oz. sliced mushrooms
• 2 Tbsp. tomato paste
• 2 cups red wine(I like cabernet)
• 2 bay leaves
• 2/3 cup water
• 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped 
For the Polenta:
• 2 cups chicken stock
• 2 cups half and half
• 1 cup polenta or grits
• 2 tbsp. butter
• 1/2 cup freshly grated parmesan
• salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:
For the Short Ribs:
1. Preheat oven to 225 degrees
2. Heat olive oil on the stovetop in a dutch oven or cast iron skillet over medium heat
3. Season all sides of the short ribs with salt and pepper
4. Add short ribs to hot oil and sear for 2-3 minutes on each side until well browned
5. Remove short ribs from dutch oven and set aside
6. Return dutch oven to burner and add onion and garlic. Add a little extra olive oil to the pan if needed. Saute 2-3 minutes until onion is translucent
7. Add mushrooms to dutch oven and stir to combine. Cook 5-7 minutes more, until mushrooms have reduced and onions have begun to caramelize
8. Add salt and pepper to taste
9. Add tomato paste and stir to combine
10. Add red wine to dutch oven to deglaze. Make sure to scrape any browned bits off the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon
11. Add bay leaves and water to the pot and stir to combine. Bring the mixture up to a low simmer, then remove from heat
12. Add short ribs back to the dutch oven
13. Cover dutch oven and place in 225 degree oven. Bake for 4 hours until short ribs easily pull apart with a fork or spatula 
14. Remove short ribs from oven and let cool for 10-15 minutes. Skim off any fat that's risen to the top
15. You can reduce the broth if you would like a more gravy like consistency
16. Pull the short ribs into smaller pieces and remove the bones and the bay leaves from the pot. Serve short ribs immediately over Parmesan Polenta(recipe below). Garnish with a bit of fresh chopped parsley. 
For the Polenta:
Add 2 cups chicken stock and 2 cups half and half to a large saucepan over med-high heat. Bring to a boil and slowly whisk in the polenta, then reduce heat to med-low. Cook for 10 minutes, giving the polenta a stir every couple of minutes to keep from sticking to the bottom. When the polenta is cooked and thickened, add the butter and parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Stir well to completely incorporate the cheese and butter.
